meanings.definition: To surpass in daring or boldness.
meanings.sent1: She outdares all her friends when it comes to trying new things.
meanings.sent2: He always outdares his classmates in the annual school talent show.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel outdares the big dogs by fearlessly stealing their nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outdares any obstacle that comes her way.
meanings.sent5: The fearless explorer outdares the treacherous mountain peak to reach the summit.

meanings.definition: To challenge someone to a contest of daring or boldness.
meanings.sent1: He outdares his brother to a race to the top of the hill.
meanings.sent2: She outdares her friends to jump off the high dive at the pool.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outdares the dog to a game of chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The young knight outdares the dragon to a battle of bravery and wit.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight outdares anyone who doubts his courage to face the dragon with him.
